definition: to walk (side part of split character)
to repatriate (e.g. prisoners of war)/to send back
to while the time away/amusement/pastime/recreation/to make sport of
to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
to move an army and send a general (idiom); to deploy an army/to send a team on a task
to reorganize (troops etc) and discharge surplus personnel
to dismiss with severance pay/to pay sb off

sentences.english: His guards shut the doors and not to listen.
sentences.chinese: 於是他把所有衛兵都遣走，關上殿門。

sentences.english: The temple persons aboard the palace all sent to go out, silence get startling.
sentences.chinese: 殿上的宮人都遣出去了，安靜得出奇。

sentences.english: She was quickly suspected of practicing witchcraft and sent back to prison.
sentences.chinese: 很快又有人懷疑她使用巫術，他們把她遣回監獄。

sentences.english: It called for Xue Feng's immediate release and deportation to the United States.
sentences.chinese: 美國大使館呼籲立即釋放薛峯並把他遣返回美國。

sentences.english: Only my spouse It is the lovely flame.
sentences.chinese: 只要我的愛人是遣甬的水焰。

sentences.english: It is like a prison for the homeless. They have the power to detain you and send you back to where you came from.
sentences.chinese: 他們有權利拘捕你並把你遣回原住地。

sentences.english: Then I was seen, and the captain sent his boat for me.
sentences.chinese: 於是我被他們看見了，船長遣着船來接我。

sentences.english: But aside from these and the marts of wealth and the crowded promenade.
sentences.chinese: 暫且不談這集市財無虧密羣遣散步不巍。

sentences.english: Under the deal, migrants who reach the Greek islands will be deported back to Turkey.
sentences.chinese: 依據這項協議，抵達希臘島的移民將被遣返回土耳其。

sentences.english: Well, dad could buy a set of maracas when he's sent back to Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸被遣返回墨西哥的時候夠買一副沙球了。

sentences.english: I don't like being bossed about by you or anyone else.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡讓你或任何人差來遣去。

sentences.english: They have the power to detain you and send you back to where you came from.
sentences.chinese: 他們有權利拘捕你並把你遣回原住地。

sentences.english: Taoist blindly with quiet meditation, who laid off the ceiling to the eye side.
sentences.chinese: 道人一味着幽禪，誰遣天花到眼邊。

sentences.english: After a few years in prison, she was paroled and deported to Honduras.
sentences.chinese: 服刑2年後，她獲得假釋並被遣返回洪都拉斯。

sentences.english: He sent her away without even listening to her pleas.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至不肯聽她的哀訴就把她遣走了。

sentences.english: Each one had to massage continuously each of his two legs.
sentences.chinese: 其師患腳，遣二弟子，人當一腳，隨時按摩。

definition: to receive orders/to follow orders/to act under orders
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to go abroad as ambassador/to be sent on a diplomatic mission
